Deva Gowda wrote:
> to find the reason for failure and to see where it
> failed and why, don't you think a good debugging ide
> like jbuilder, eclipse ot net beans would be a good
> idea.

Of course you have to use every mean possible to fix a bug.  But praying 
doesn't work :-)  If it's using a debugger, so be it.

The problem with a debugger is that after a debugging session, all the 
information you grabbed is... in your head.  And not in your tests.

If you are using a debugger and after you have found the problem, try to 
write a test to reproduce the bug and fix the problem.  After this, you 
will have at least several additional tests.

-Vladimir
